description.plain:
Lovejoy is an indie-rock band based in Brighton, England. Its members include Wilbur Soot as the lead vocalist and rhythm guitarist, Joe Goldsmith as lead guitarist and backup vocalist, Ash Kabosu as the bassist, and Mark Boardman on the drums.

Upon the band’s debut, they gained popularity on the internet, where their YouTube channel quickly gained 100,000 subscribers just a few days after its creation on May 6th, 2021. Four days later, on May 10th, they released their first EP titled Are You Alright?. On October 14th, their second EP Pebble Brain was released, featuring seven new songs.

In February 2023, the band released their first stand-alone single, “Call Me What You Like,” which would go on to chart at #32 in the UK singles chart in its first week. The track would later be announced to be part of a much larger project, the long awaited third EP from the band, Wake Up & It’s Over, a five track project, released in May of the same year.

The year of 2023 would also see the band perform at Reading & Leeds Festivals in the UK, Outside Lands Festival in the US, and Open'er Festival in Poland, which showed the band’s growth from playing their first small show to around fifty people in a brewery in Brighton, to thousands at the UK’s most famous music festivals.

Wilbur Soot is widely known for having an affinity to the band Los Campesinos!, which inspired the band’s single cover “Knee Deep at ATP”.

Four days later, on May 10th, they released their first EP titled Are You Alright?. On October 14th, their second EP Pebble Brain was released, featuring seven new songs.

In February 2023, the band released their first stand-alone single, “Call Me What You Like,” which would go on to chart at #32 in the UK singles chart in its first week. The track would later be announced to be part of a much larger project, the long awaited third EP from the band, Wake Up & It’s Over, a five track project, released in May of the same year.

The year of 2023 would also see the band perform at Reading & Leeds Festivals in the UK, Outside Lands Festival in the US, and Open'er Festival in Poland, which showed the band’s growth from playing their first small show to around fifty people in a brewery in Brighton, to thousands at the UK’s most famous music festivals.

songs.title: One Day

description.plain:
“One Day” is a hope-filled song that talks about improving the future despite hardships faced in the past. It specifically focuses on the singer’s relationship with his lover mentioned throughout the song, with him wanting to take her back despite her not being a good life partner.

The lead vocalist of the band, Wilbur Soot, played a couple of clips from the demo of this song during his Twitch live stream on April 14th, 2021, making the song the only one teased before the EP in which it features on, Are You Alright? was released. He told fans in this stream that he personally believes it’s the least impressive song on the release, but also stated that he doesn’t dislike it.

songs.title: The Fall

description.plain:
In “The Fall”, Wilbur Soot sings from the perspective of the wealthy, who have begun to grow apathetic about life, experience depression, and take antidepressants to feel better, up until the point where they have a mental breakdown. The song incorporates explicit references to the tense political climate in Britain, specifically the hopelessness that many opponents of the conservative party feel upon seeing them gain more and more power in recent years.

“The Fall” includes a moderately fast rock beat heavily accompanied with the drumset and electric guitars. Lovejoy teased a recording session of the song in June 2021. After the song released, Genius released an article that broke down parts of the song.

songs.embed_content: Read “The Fall” by Lovejoy on Genius

songs.lyrics:
215 ContributorsThe Fall Lyrics[Verse 1]
Under the weight of a broken nose
It's not that simple, but he won't seem to notice
There must be more to this
So leave those sink estates, and let's book a holiday
We're painting all the counties in blue
'Cause we're already boring, and we're already hoarding
What else have we got left to accrue?

[Chorus]
And the ramblers will say
"It's got a marvellous view!"
But they don't know how many lives it took, no
Thеy'll never know what you knew

[Refrain]
And wе're so calm, but we're— (Fucking scared, fucking scared!)
And we're so calm, but we're— (Fucking scared, fucking scared!)
And we're so calm, but we're— (Fucking scared, fucking scared!)
And we're so calm, but we're fucking scared of people like you!

[Verse 2]
Under the weight of some Sertraline
A couple Prozacs, and now I'm pumping dopamine!
There must be more to this
We've got a country house now, old dog has been put down now
It's nice to be around trees
Custom license plate on our Audi R8
How many grocers does one county need?
You might also like[Chorus]
And the ramblers will say
"It's still a marvellous view!"
But that treadmill still looms
Of your hedonic misuse

[Instrumental Break]

[Breakdown]
So come on, one and all and see the apathy!
The reams of grey stencils that fill the tapestry
I look to all of you and see a different fucking species!
Aspiration for a different destination to me
Across the Pennines, there's a thin blue line, a knife and a mall
I would do something, if it wasn't all so effort-full
'Cause I'm so high,  my brain can't even look at the fall
And when you've reached the top, there's nowhere else to go but...

[Outro]
*exhale*95Embed

songs.title: Sex Sells

description.plain:
“Sex Sells” is the third track on Lovejoy’s debut EP titled “Are You Alright?” which was released on May 10th, 2021 and produced by Cameron Nesbitt. The band has not yet come out and said anything about the song (As of May 11th, 2021)

Sex Sells is about a woman who is partaking in a relationship with another man while the singer feels dejected and jealous while the woman he wants is with another man.

Lead singer Wilbur Soot said on Reddit that “Sex Sells” is about extortion (of money, not sex).
